channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Building works blocking bike lane, 16th July
item.description:
The building works at Brettenham House have been pushed out further into the road, blocking bikes from moving southbound when there is motor traffic moving northbound
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Savoy Street, Holborn, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree needs cutting back, 16th July
item.description:
Hi I’ve contacted before and I’ve contacted chislehurst matters and the councillor of chislehurst and no one can help but this tree has damaged the decking of the garden and my children can’t use the garden the tree has made the decking weak which has now caused the decking to have holes in which is now unsafe. It’s constantly dropping branches in the garden it is so big and obviously just going to keep growing and damaging my garden until it’s cut back. I cannot cut this down myself it is so high and unsafe

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Telegraph Path, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste ripped - boxes and broken down furniture, 16th July
item.description:
Flytipping

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 194, Croydon Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain completely blocked, 16th July
item.description:
This drain opposite 7/8 Leinster Square has been blocked for months and recent cleaning seems to have missed it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leinster Square, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant wet patch on pavement, 16th July
item.description:
I have reported this several times over the past few years. Thames water have said that it’s not their issue. There’s no way that the pavement should be wet in this one spot after all the recent hot weather we have had. There has to be some sort of leak under the pavement. With all the sink holes over the past few years, I believe that this patch is worth investigating.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weir Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping between 41-43 Chessington Avenue, 16th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chessington Avenue, Upper Belvedere, London

item.title: Repeated incidents of dog waste, 16th July
item.description:
Repeated incidents of dog waste on both sides of Cyrena Road, particularly the section leading from Whateley Road towards Heber Road / which is used by many school children and represents a health and safety risk.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cyrena Road, East Dulwich, London

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wallis Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Road sinking, 16th July
item.description:
This problem was supposed to be fixed. The road was closed for two days. The sink hole is back bigger you have reported that works will be carried out 4th Aug to fix but it needs to be now vehicles are being damaged.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 89, Southlands Road, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: My floor was not been clean, 16th July
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Springfield, Hackney, London

item.title: Flytip rubbish again in Chislehurst!, 16th July
item.description:
Someone has dumped bags and bags of rubbish on the little lane going into the cricket pitch in Chislehurst - the side by Norlanda Crescent off summer hill Absolutely disgusting and seems to be a real problem in chislehurst I am slightly concerned about what’s in the bags and many children and dog walkers walk here every day

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cricket Ground Road, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned white retro scooter dumped in River Cray - can see from bridge that goes over the river from the footpath from St James' Church, 16th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Five Arches, North Cray, London
